snippet: In an experiment, blind people using echolocation misjudged objects in the way those with vision did.
abstract: Dr Gavin Buckingham study in journal Psychological Science finds that blind people who use echolocation, or use of sound and echo to identify objects, can experience illusions, just as sighted people do.
lead_paragraph: In an experiment, blind people using echolocation misjudged objects in the way those with vision did.

headline.print_headline: Psychology: Illusions Fool Even the Blind
